AREA I
VISION, MISSION,
GOALS AND
OBJECTIVES

PARAMETER A
STATEMENT OF
VISION, MISSION,
GOALS AND
OBJECTIVES

S.1. The institution has a system of
determining the vision and mission.

CASCADING OF NATIONAL AND REGIONAL GOALS TO THE INSTITUTIONAL LEVEL
National Goals Free enterprise as a way of fighting poverty through creation of jobs.
Regional Goals ➢ Provision of socio – economic support in the CALABARZON area ➢ Encouragement of Industrial development
Provincial Goals (Cavite)
➢ Livelihood and entrepreneurship development ➢ Responsive education and manpower development
Municipal Goals (Tanza)
➢ Provide continuing education for local governance ➢ Strengthen and enhance linkages and partnership with various leagues ➢ Strengthen partnership with local academic Institution
Institutional Goals (Cavite State University) ➢ Improvement and raising the standards of living of the constituents through economic prosperity by maximizing industrial activity and commerce ➢ Provision of adequate and educational facilities to accommodate projected needs due to population growth
Tanza Campus Goals (Cavite State University) ➢ high quality instruction in order to produce skilled, morally upright and globally competitive graduates; ➢ Develop and pursue advance research activities through arts, sciences, and technology to support instruction; ➢ Develop and conduct extension activities that will empower people and communities. Provide high quality instruction in order to produce skilled, morally upright and globally
Teacher Education Department Objectives (Cavite State University ➢ provide relevant and quality course offering for pre-service teachers to improve their performance; ➢ conduct relevant researches in the teacher education and allied courses to produce good leaders and professionals; and ➢ conduct relevant community services to disseminate information and technologies to target clienteles to improve their well-being.
Program Goals (Bachelor of Secondary Education based on CMO 75 s. 2017) The BSEd degree program aims to develop highly education program designed to equip learners with adequate and relevant competencies to teach in their chosen area of specialization/major in the secondary level.
Prepared by: Noted:
MILDRED A. SEBASTIAN GIL D. RAMOS, MAHisto Chairperson, TED Campus Administrator

Chronological Events Supporting the Chronological Events Supporting the
Formulation of CvSU VMGO Formulation of CvSU VMGO
A series of meetings were conducted to formulate, review, and revise the CvSU Vision, A series of meetings were conducted to formulate, review, and revise the CvSU Vision, Mission, Goals, and Objectives. The chronological events supporting the formulation of the Mission, Goals, and Objectives. The chronological events supporting the formulation of the VMGO of CvSU are illustrated below. VMGO of CvSU are illustrated below. Republic Act No. 8468 January 22, 1988 Republic Act No. 8468 Don Severino Agricultural College (DSAC) was elevated into Don Severino Agricultural College (DSAC) was elevated into University now known as Cavite State University (CvSU) University now known as Cavite State University (CvSU) The University has an existing Development Agenda 1998-2006 The University has an existing Development Agenda 1998-2006 Revisiting Vision and Mission Statements Revisiting Vision and Mission Statements
February 27-28 2001 Institutional Planning and Development Workshop Institutional Planning and Development Workshop Conducted to harmonize philosophies, thrusts and directions Conducted to harmonize philosophies, thrusts and directions among campuses among campuses participants were administrators and middle management participants were administrators and middle management officers of the Cavite College of Fisheries (CACOF) and Cavite officers of the Cavite College of Fisheries (CACOF) and Cavite College and Arts and Trades (CCAT) and CvSU College and Arts and Trades (CCAT) and CvSU
June 7-8 2001 Performance commitments of different units for AY 2001-2002 Performance commitments of different units for AY 2001-2002 Initial review of Vision and Mission statements of the university Initial review of Vision and Mission statements of the university Student representatives from all campuses took part Student representatives from all campuses took part
Approved University Code by the Board of Regents (BOR) per April 5, 2005 Approved University Code by the Board of Regents (BOR) per Resolution No. 12 Series of 2005 Resolution No. 12 Series of 2005
November 23, 2011 Filipino Translation of University Vision and Mission Filipino Translation of University Vision and Mission
